li.a: 4/9/2020 Letter from CCS Elementary Principal to Families
IMPORTANT INSTRUCTION INFORMATION - Letter to Families - March 31, 2020

p.strong: SCHOOL BASED HEALTH CENTER (SBHC) at CCS is NOW SUSPENDED

div.p: March 30, 2020 - Your School Based Health clinic is still available to help! Please contact us through our 1-844-255-7242 (All-SBHC) line to speak with someone, OR sign up for MyBassett! We are encouraging all families to sign each child up for MyBassett as this is an easy way to connect with your SBH clinic for questions or concerns regarding your healthcare needs, and is a way to access telemedicine video appointments with your provider.
Sign up either online or through the Bassett hotline:
https://www.mybassetthealthconnection.org/mychart-prd/Authentication/Login?
This message from Jane Hamilton, School-Based Health Practice Manager III:

As the COVID 19 situation evolves we are all forced to make very difficult decision. Today, with leaders of the Department of Pediatrics we have decided to suspend care at all SBHCs with the exception of Unadilla Valley.

The SBHC 844 phone line will remain operational. Families may be connected to a Nurse Practitioner/Physician Assistant or Mental Health Clinician on call and possibly via ZOOM visits. Our Mental Health Clinician have been checking up on their patients by phone…we do not want any family or child to feel that we have abandoned them. If someone needs care we will do everything we can to make those arrangements.

We continue to need staff to monitor the temperature of the vaccine refrigeration and freezer units every 5 days. If for some reason that is not or will not be feasible we would ask for 24-48 hours’ notice so that we may transport the vaccine in a safe, temperature controlled manner to another location.

We had hoped it would not come to this, however for the safety of all of us and the need to be good stewards of valuable medical supplies it became necessary. Many of our staff will be redeployed to other areas in the organization to assist during a time critical workforce shortages.
For questions, please call SBHC at (607) 547-5069 or 1-844-255-7242.

li.a: Travel: Frequently Asked Questions and Answers
Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) – Frequently Asked Questions – Prevention

ul.li: New York Novel Coronavirus Hotline, Call 1-888-364-3065

div.p: April 16, 2020

Dear families, I hope you’re well. We are grateful for your continued support and feedback related to our closure. During a press briefing earlier today, Governor Cuomo announced that NY PAUSE, which has restricted all nonessential businesses from operating, will be extended until at least May 15th. School districts will be prohibited from opening until at least this time. I am still awaiting the executive order for this announcement, but in the meantime, we are updating what we can on the website and other social media platforms. There are many implications for extended closure, as anticipated. We will be prepared, and are working to provide communication about important information related to instruction, student events, and related responsibilities of our school district to our students and our Cooperstown community. I look forward to communicating more details to you as soon as they are available, Please stay safe. Dr. Crankshaw

h3.strong: IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR FAMILIES - SPECIAL EDUCATION CPSE/CSE/504 MEETINGS

div.p: Cooperstown Central School District has scheduled upcoming CPSE/CSE/504 meetings. PLEASE CLICK HERE TO READ LETTER.

Modified, but complete school breakfast and lunch meals will be available to all students at no cost during this time of school closure. To request meals please call the Food Service Office at 547-2820 or email Melissa Rathbun at mrathbun@cooperstowncs.org.

Meal pickup will be available at the Junior-Senior High School only on Monday and Wednesday, between the hours of 11am-1pm and 5-7pm, they will include breakfast and lunch for all five days of the week.
For the few families that will need us to deliver the meals – it will be our pleasure to do so. Please let us know by calling 547-2820.
A counselor can be contacted via the email addresses listed below:
Mrs. Katie Baldo (grades 11-12) kbaldo@cooperstowncs.org
Mr. Gregg Sanik (grades 9-10) gsanik@cooperstowncs.org
Mrs. Christine McBrearty-Hulse (grades 5-8) cmcbrearty@cooperstowncs.org
Ms. Sara Mileski (grades K-4)
Mrs. Mary Clare Roberts (School Social Worker) mcroberts@cooperstowncs.org

Non-emergent needs can be scheduled during regular school business hours. You will receive a response within 24 hours to make a phone appointment with a Counselor. In the case of an emergency, please call MCAT (844-732-6228) or 911.
Social/Emotional Support Resources for Families:

ol.li: Practice mindfulness! Simply take a moment to focus on your breath or do a search online for a guided relaxation. Here are some places to get started:

div.p: Check out Mindful Schools’ Kids Classes! (K-5)
2.Create Your Own Stress Management Plan ( https://www.healthychildren.org/English/Documents/BR3_My_Personal_Stress_Plan.pdf
3.Talking with Children About the Coronavirus from Child Mind Institute
4.Self Care in the Time of Coronavirus https://childmind.org/article/self-care-in-the-time-of-coronavirus/
5.Stress and Coping https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/daily-life-coping/managing-stress-anxiety.html?CDC

The CCS Counseling Office has started Google Classrooms for students in grades 7-8 and 9-12 as one way to help maintain connections between students and counselors. Invitations to CCS Counseling Google Classrooms were emailed to all CCS student accounts in the Jr./Sr. High School. These "classrooms" are being utilized to promote social-emotional health and provide students with optional activities to do, articles to read, and coping skills to try. They connect CCS students with several helpful resources during this school closure time. If you are a parent/guardian of a CCS student grades 7-12, please encourage your student(s) to join their corresponding CCS Counseling Office Google Classroom. CCS students can email Mrs. Roberts at mcroberts@cooperstowncs.org with any questions or if they need the invitation link to be re-sent to them. Be well and stay safe everyone!
